ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Oil painting techniques - assignment topics included a greyscale still-life, a color wheel, figure drawings, and self-portraits.
Oil painting (still lifes, portraits, a little bit of figure painting) and some color theory. We learned/were encouraged to explore different techniques like glazing.

I gained a deeper awareness of how colors interact and how to paint more intentionally. We spoke a lot about value, hue, and saturation of colors. I learned to paint outside of my comfort zone, whether that be with different tools, techniques, materials, or canvas types/sizes that I use. I learned how to talk about paintings in a new way.
I learned how to use the oil paint medium, how to use alternative materials to create texture on the canvas, and how to create a realistic still life depictions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think it would have been helpful to start color a bit earlier in the semester. Also, more life models! Those classes really forced us to capture gesture quickly and think about the whole human form.

Strengths - taught very well, if you like painting you'll love the class! Only weakness is that there are times during the semester that you have very little work and other times where you feel swamped.

Strengths: I learned a lot and will probably continue to paint in the future. I acquired a new hobby.
Weaknesses: Honestly, I think the bar was a little too high for an intro course. I constantly felt like I wasn't doing enough which took a lot of the fun out of the class.
More instruction on composition and how to paint

Strengths: Beverly is wonderful and a fun instructor to have! The class environment felt very relaxed. We always had access to the art studio, so we could pretty much paint whenever we wanted to. We painted all different types of things: objects, places, people, ourselves, so we really got a good breadth of types of paintings. We were encouraged to paint outside of our comfort zones and try new supplies and styles.
Weaknesses: It's easy to spend way too much time on a painting, and you may never really feel done with your paintings, which can be frustrating. Not all supplies are provided, and oil paints and art supplies are very expensive.

I feel more confident about oil painting, both in terms of technical skills and foundational knowledge. I think the one weakness of this course was pacing. It was very slow in the beginning and we spent a lot of time on the basics such as color wheel, value, still life. Then we jumped from that to self portraits/figure drawing/final project, which felt like a big leap.

I felt I strongly brought creative ideas towards every project I completed. I also strongly used color mixtures in my creations and never shyed away from the material. I struggled to create realistic still life images, which improved on greatly, because this was my first painting class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes!! If you like painting or art in general, take this class.

If you're an art major and need to take this, then sure. Otherwise, I would proceed with caution. I definitely learned a LOT from this class and now feel comfortable with an entirely new medium. It was fun to immerse myself in a class that had a totally different pace and environment, and I am very thankful for everything I learned and probably don't regret it. However, this is NOT a gut. I would spend just as much time, if not probably more, doing work for this class than I did for a lot of my tougher STEM classes. Also, this will not be an easy A if you take it with Professor Acha. You might even need to fight for a B or a C. She is very strict on attendance and grades harshly. That said, I've heard that the other section is very different and potentially easier in terms of grades.

Yes! I learned so much from this class and Beverly made such a great environment for developing your own artistic voice. It was super beginner friendly but people from all levels can get a lot out of the class.

Absolutely! If you enjoy painting or just generally being creative, this is the class for you! Be prepared to spend time on your paintings--as long as you're intentional about the decisions you make and put in effort to finish them, you'll be all set. I love painting, so this class brought a lot of joy to my semester and fun homework to balance things out.
Yes, I learned so much about basic painting skills. I feel I can build upon these skills confidently in my own creations and in more difficult painting classes.
